--- title: Estimating Lift date: "2022-10-10" code-fold: false echo: false fig-cap-location: top categories: [Statistics, AB Testing] number-sections: false --- This post is intended to demonstrate: * How to estimate "lift" over some baseline metric. The point estimate is the easy part, but we will also go over how to construct (and report) confidence intervals for lift. * How to estimate "lift" in a regression. You're probably using logistic regression to analyze binary experiments (which is fine), but I'm going to show you that you'd probably be better off using Poisson regression with robust covariance estimation instead. And, because this is would be kind of boring in R, I'm going to do it in python (because a lot of AB testing questions I've seen on cross validated are in python). ## Experiment Let's say you run a 2x2 factorial experiment to estimate the lift of two interventions and their interaction.
